title: Add the date and time in a readable format to a comment
content:
Service Management dates are all stored using a unix timestamp, these values need to be converted using the ‘format’ function in order to display the date in a user-friendly manner. The dates are stored in the local server time, so a time zone offset needs to be used to display the date in local time. For example, if the server location is in London, England, and the user wanted the time to appear as the local time in Moscow, the time offset between London and Moscow needs to be added to the now() function. Three hours is 10800000 milliseconds, so the rule to add this would be: ${format(now()+10800000,'long')}. The long parameter always adds the time zone of the server, in the below case PDT. Using the short parameter removes the time zone.
